metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Python, Bootstrap, Java and XML.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: To create our first SFC web page from scratch we will:
content.html: To create our first SFC web page from scratch we will:

content.text: Now we will remove all content in the example project we made on the previous page to create our own simple web page in Vue.
content.html: Now we will remove all content in the example project we made on the previous page to create our own simple web page in Vue.

content.text: Before we start to write code, remove all content inside the <template> , <script> and <style> tags, and remove any attributes like 'setup' or 'scoped'.
content.html: Before we start to write code, remove all content inside the <template>, <script> and <style> tags, and remove any attributes like 'setup' or 'scoped'.

content.text: Your 'App.vue' file should now look like this:
content.html: Your 'App.vue' file should now look like this:

script
>
</

</

<
style
>
</

>
content.code_html:
<script></script>

<template></template>

<style></style>

content.text: Also remove the folders 'assets' and 'components' inside the 'src' folder.
content.html: Also remove the folders 'assets' and 'components' inside the 'src' folder.

content.text: Remove the line where assets are imported inside the 'main.js' file so that 'main.js' looks like this:
content.html: Remove the line where assets are imported inside the 'main.js' file so that 'main.js' looks like this:

content.code:
import

{
createApp
}

from

'vue'


import
App
from

'./App.vue'



createApp
(
App
)
.
mount
(
'#app'
)
content.code_html:
import { createApp } from 'vue'
import App from './App.vue'

createApp(App).mount('#app')

content.text: We now have an empty project to work with.
content.html: We now have an empty project to work with.

content.text: Now that we have a clean project, add a header inside the <template> tag, like this:
content.html: Now that we have a clean project, add a header inside the <template> tag, like this:

content.code_html:
<template>
  <h1>Hello World!</h1>
</template>

<script></script>
<style></style>

content.text: Save the 'App.vue' file, go to your browser by following the localhost link in the terminal. Do you see the result? The browser should now update automatically every time you save a change in VS Code, without having to manually refresh the browser.
content.html: Save the 'App.vue' file, go to your browser by following the localhost link in the terminal. Do you see the result? The browser should now update automatically every time you save a change in VS Code, without having to manually refresh the browser.

content.text: Now lets take a look at a slightly larger Vue example:
content.html: Now lets take a look at a slightly larger Vue example:

content.code:
<
template
>


<
h1
>
{{ message }}
</
h1
>


</
template
>



<
script
>


export

default

{


data
(
)

{


return

{

message
:

'This is some text'


}
;


}


}
;


</
script
>



<
style
>
</

>
content.code_html:
<template>
  <h1>{{ message }}</h1>
</template>

<script>
export default {
  data() {
    return {
      message: 'This is some text'
    };
  }
};
</script>

<style></style>

content.text: Note: In the example above, export default makes it possible for 'main.js' to catch the data with the import App from './App.vue' so that it can be mounted on the <div id="app"> tag inside 'index.html'.
content.html: Note: In the example above, export default makes it possible for 'main.js' to catch the data with the import App from './App.vue' so that it can be mounted on the <div id="app"> tag inside 'index.html'.

content.text: What is the command we need to write to run the project in development mode?
content.html: What is the command we need to write to run the project in development mode?
